image.altText: Dutton walks next to a car

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton will promise to halve the tax on fuel for 12 months in his budget reply on Thursday, which the Coalition says would save a two-car household roughly $28 a week on average and reduce inflationary pressures.

title.children: Coalition promises to halve fuel excise, shaving 25c off a litre of petrol

image.altText: Peter Dutton smiles with trees behind him

props.synopsis: Politics is about principles and the opposition leader's decision to say no to a tax cut sends a signal.

title.children: Dutton is grappling with his fourth major political call as opposition leader

image.altText: An older woman walks down a crowded aisle at a grocery store.

props.synopsis: Research from consumer advocacy group Choice has found the average basket of groceries is now costing Woolworths shoppers more than it was a year ago, while the price has fallen at both Coles and Aldi.

title.children: Choice report finds Woolworths groceries more expensive than a year ago

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin smiles

props.synopsis: The Russian President reportedly wants Ukraine to cede territory his troops have never occupied as part of negotiations taking place to end the war, which continues to rage despite multiple summits.

title.children: Putin's 'crazy' ceasefire demands akin to British 'reoccupying' NSW

image.altText: Pete Hegseth stands behind Donald Trump in the Oval Office.

props.synopsis: It piles pressure on Donald Trump's administration, which has insisted no US service personnel were put at risk due to the leak of sensitive information.

title.children: New Signal messages show Pentagon chief shared live updates on Houthi attack

image.altText: CCTV footage of a store alight

props.synopsis: Successive governments have increased the tax on cigarettes and tobacco to drive down smoking rates — but having helped with one problem, it has contributed to another.

title.children: Up in smoke: How Australia's fight with big tobacco fuelled a black market

image.altText: Generic child toys

props.synopsis: New analysis reveals just how lucrative Australia's childcare real estate market is while parents face perpetual fee hikes.

title.children: Childcare landlords are collecting a staggering $2.7b in rent every year while parents' fees rise

image.altText: Jim Chalmers laughing.

props.synopsis: The $5-a-week tax cuts revealed in the federal budget have passed the senate in a late night sitting.

title.children: Surprise tax cuts pass the senate, Coalition votes no

image.altText: Multiple packets of colourful pharmaceutical medicines.

props.synopsis: The head of one of America's largest pharmaceutical companies says he does not support tariffs on Australian medicines as US President Donald Trump considers more trade restrictions.

title.children: American big pharma boss does not support tariffs on Australian medicines

image.altText: A generic graphic of the NDIS logo surrounded by budget-related paraphenalia.

props.synopsis: The NDIS is getting a lot of negative press at the moment. It’s a far cry from when the scheme first started.

title.children: There's another problem facing the NDIS — and it's not about the money

image.altText: Narrator and Producer Leonardo DiCaprio.

props.synopsis: Laws that will effectively protect salmon farming in Tasmania's Macquarie Harbour from being halted pass in the Senate late on Wednesday night, by 30 votes to 14, after earlier theatrics by Greens Senator Sarah Hanson-Young.

title.children: Senator produces dead fish as laws to protect salmon farming pass Senate

image.altText: Close up of an arm being injected with a syringe by a blue-gloved hand

props.synopsis: The administration also plans to scale back efforts to combat malaria, according to documents, but would continue grants for drugs that treat HIV and tuberculosis.

title.children: Trump administration to end funding for child vaccines in poorest nations

image.altText: A storefront with red sale signs inside and a big white sign reading 'Jeanswest'

props.synopsis: Clothing retailer Jeanswest has collapsed, with more than 90 stores set to close within months and hundreds of employees set to lose their jobs.

title.children: Clothing retailer Jeanswest collapses, hundreds of jobs to go

image.altText: A beach closed sign on the sand at Sandtrax beqach

props.synopsis: A shark warning is issued after a swimmer is bitten by a tiger shark at Perth's Sandtrax beach, near Fremantle Port.

title.children: Tiger shark 'circled boat' after biting swimmer at Fremantle beach

image.altText: A man in t-shirt and glasses smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Gold Coast retiree Adrian Sim says the treasurer has announced a "retail budget" full of sugar hits. And he is not the only one disappointed.

title.children: Australians say the budget lacks bravery and 'long-term vision'

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: exterior of a building that says law courts

props.synopsis: Approximately 9,000 court documents, including apprehended violence orders and affidavits, have been downloaded following a major data breach to the NSW Online Registry website.

title.children: NSW court website involved in major data breach, 9,000 documents leaked

image.altText: A close up of laptop screen

props.synopsis: A proposed ban on-compete clauses in employment contracts was a centrepiece of the budget. But what are they, how do they work, and why do most economists think they are bad for workers and the economy?

title.children: Why economists are so keen to abolish non-compete clauses

image.altText: Harley Reid kicks the ball

props.synopsis: West Coast's Harley Reid is given a fine by the AFL after he was shown giving Brisbane fans the middle finger in the Eagles' round two defeat at the Gabba.

title.children: Reid handed sanction after giving Lions fans the middle finger

image.altText: A close-up of Donald Trump wearing a white shirt, blue suit jacket and yellow tie

props.synopsis: One man appears to be the last remaining hurdle between Australia and the soft economic landing that the federal government and Reserve Bank have been angling for.

title.children: Budget forecasts may be blown away by Trump tariff war

image.altText: An illustration of a strange dinosaur

props.synopsis: Scientists say the Duonychus is like a "giant feathered sloth" with "big, sharp and nasty claws".

title.children: Workers uncover 'weird' dinosaur in the Gobi Desert. What do we know?

image.altText: Aerial view of water and station in Queensland

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology says people in Giru, south of Townsville, should expect the Haughton River to top its major flood level — again —  and keep rising as slashing rain continues across Queensland.

title.children: Major flood warning as rain-weary residents told to seek higher ground

image.altText: Donald Trump with his hands out and Mike Waltz standing behind him.

props.synopsis: The journalist was added to a group chat that had officials in it, discussing a planned military operation in Yemen earlier this month.

title.children: National security adviser takes 'full responsibility' after war group chat 'mistake'

props.synopsis: The Albanese government has delivered its final budget ahead of an election in May, with a fresh new round of tax cuts the major offer. Find out who else is set to benefit and who may miss out.

title.children: Find out if you're among the budget's winners or losers

image.altText: An aerial photo of a school in Armidale.

props.synopsis: A 34-year-old woman is jailed for resisting and intimidating police, following a dispute involving two girls at an Armidale high school in which staff were allegedly assaulted.

title.children: Woman embroiled in school dispute given 12-month jail term on same day

image.altText: The Paddington Bear statue after it was recovered by Newbury Police.

props.synopsis: The pair drunkenly stole the statue in the early hours of the morning before fleeing in a taxi to the RAF base they live on.

title.children: RAF engineers admit damage and theft of beloved Paddington Bear statue in UK

image.altText: Orange flames seen from an aerial vantage point.

props.synopsis: Multiple wildfires are raging across South Korea's south-eastern region, with thousands of firefighters aided by the military deployed in a bid to contain one of the country's worst forest fires in decades.

title.children: Death toll rises in Korean wildfires as firefighters struggle to contain blaze

image.altText: woman lying down clutching a hot water bottle to her abdomen

props.synopsis: The changes included may save some women "thousands of dollars across their lifetimes", according to budget documents.

title.children: Women’s health a 'national priority' as budget unveils $793m investment

image.altText: Tulsi Gabbard and John Ratcliffe seated at a bench with binders of papers in front of them.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump defends the top adviser who inadvertently looped a magazine editor into a war group chat, saying he'd "learned a lesson" from the "glitch".

title.children: 'Learned a lesson': Trump defends aide's group chat 'glitch'

image.altText: Women hold signs that read 'March 4 Justice' and 'Enough is Enough' at a rally protesting the treatment of women in politics

props.synopsis: Interviewees were granted anonymity to discuss their experiences, with 150 women telling their stories about the abuse they had received in politics.

title.children: 'Show me your underwear, I'll vote for you': Women in politics reveal abuse

image.altText: Grey, blue, pink and yellow egg cartons sit for sale on a shelf

props.synopsis: After making the price of eggs a key election issue, Donald Trump is importing them from as far away as Türkiye and South Korea to tackle continuing shortages.

title.children: Donald Trump is shopping for hundreds of millions of eggs

image.altText: Exterior of the Royal Darwin Hospital's emergency and trauma centre.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory coroner has found "systemic failures" contributed to a woman’s "confronting" death at Royal Darwin Hospital following routine elective surgery on her knee.

title.children: 'Systemic failures' found in woman's post-surgery death at Darwin hospital

image.altText: silouette of crisafulli with gabba lights in the background

props.synopsis: Athletics Australia has accused the Queensland government of "overlooking" track and field in its Brisbane Olympics plan, saying the sport will receive "no legacy benefits" beyond the 2032 Games.

title.children: Brisbane to become the only capital that can't host national athletics

image.altText: Five staff members of a resort stand on the beach and wave happily with their left hands

props.synopsis: Yes, there is yet another streaming service arriving on our shores. But things are a little different with this one, and it could up-end the Australian TV landscape.

title.children: HBO's streaming service is coming to Australia. It could change everything

image.altText: A pile of dusty, worn out and damaged typres on a patch of dirt with a green tree behind it on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: About 10,000 tyres have been found at an illegal dump at Lockwood South, near Bendigo, sparking a statewide operation by the EPA.

title.children: More than 100 businesses linked to illegal tyre stockpile near Bendigo
